LightSwitch.title: Device description
LightSwitch.name: LightSwitch
LightSwitch.overview: With this device a simple light can be switched on and off. The event display can be used to indicate an error from the device. NOTE FOR SWITCH : If within 5 seconds the appropriate status does not return to the command that was sent, the switch automatically sends the "On" command once and than the "Off" command.

table.name: On (Switch)
table.description: On = With On, the On command for the light can be sent.

table.name: Off (Switch)
table.description: Off = With Off the off-command for the light can be sent.

table.name: State (Switch)
table.description: State = Light State serves as feedback from the terminal device and returns the current status.

table.name: ErrorWarningState (ShowEvent)
table.description: Here you can specify a variable to indicate a warning or error directly on the device. The warning is indicated by orange flashing, an error by red flashing.

TimeSwitch.title: Device description
TimeSwitch.name: Time Switch
TimeSwitch.overview: A switch device, that configures the schedule, which is then used by backend worker to send impulses to related variables. Impulse signal is sent as value 1 and changes to value 0 after 1 second.

table.name: On
table.description: Variable which receives the ON impulse signal.

table.name: Off
table.description: Variable which receives the OFF impulse signal.

table.name: State
table.description: Variable that is displayed by device indicator. This variable is not automatically updated by the backend.

table.name: ErrorWarningState (ShowEvent)
table.description: Here you can specify a variable to indicate a warning or error directly on the device. The warning is indicated by orange flashing, an error by red flashing.

GeneralSwitchV2.title: Device description
GeneralSwitchV2.name: GeneralSwitchV2
GeneralSwitchV2.overview: With this device a general switch can be realized. The switch always sends the opposite of the value that the status currently has. As soon as the status changes the value, the send command from the switch also changes.

table.name: Switch_V2 (On, Off, State)
table.description: On/Off = If the state variable has the value 0, a 1 is always sent when the switch is activated by a click. As long as the value of the state variable has the value 1, a 0 is sent when the switch is activated by a click. State = The State serves as feedback from the terminal device and returns the current status.

table.name: ErrorWarningState (ShowEvent)
table.description: Here you can specify a variable to indicate a warning or error directly on the device. The warning is indicated by orange flashing, an error by red flashing.

ImpulseButton.title: Device description
ImpulseButton.name: Impulse Button
ImpulseButton.overview: Device that sends a signal with value 1 and reverts to value 0 after one second.

table.name: ImpulseButton (OnOff)
table.description: On = Variable for impulse signal.

table.name: ErrorWarningState (ShowEvent)

LightDimmer.title: Device description
LightDimmer.name: LightDimmer
LightDimmer.overview: With this device a dimmer can be displayed. Via the switch it offers the possibility to switch the light on and off. Via the slider the brightness can be adjusted. The output field displays the current actual value from the dimmer. Via the event display an error can be indicated by the device. NOTE FOR SWITCH : If within 5 seconds the appropriate status does not return to the command that was sent, the switch automatically sends the "On" command once and than the "Off" command.

LightRGB.title: Device description
LightRGB.name: LightRGB
LightRGB.overview: This unit can be used to control an RGB light. It can be turned on and off with the switch. The RGB slider can be used to adjust the color of the lamp. The brightness can be adjusted with the slider. The output field shows the current actual value of the dimmer. The 3 output fields above the color slider show the current value of the colors. An error by the device can be indicated via the event display. NOTE FOR SWITCH : If within 5 seconds the appropriate status does not return to the command that was sent, the switch automatically sends the "On" command once and than the "Off" command.

ControlBlinds.title: Device description
ControlBlinds.name: ControlBlinds
ControlBlinds.overview: With this device it is possible to control a blind. With the arrow keys the blind can be moved up or down at full speed. The current value of the slider shows the current position of the blind. By moving the slider you can change the desired target position and move the blind there according to the logic of the slider. Using the drop down it would be possible to set a desired turning position of the slats of the blind. The current position is displayed in the output field. Via the event display an error by the device can be indicated. In addition, the movement time can be indicated separately in seconds. It is also possible to control the basic position movement. The movement time of the slats from fully open to fully closed can be specified separately.

table.name: Up (Arrow up)
table.description: Up = With Up, the Up command for the blinds can be sent.

table.name: State (Arrow up)
table.description: State = Up State serves as feedback from the terminal device and returns the current status.

table.description: State = Down State serves as feedback from the terminal device and returns the current status.

table.description: The slider sends the current target value for the blinds position to the device.

table.name: Target Value Slats Position (Drop Down)
table.description: With the selection in the drop down different positions of the slats of the blind can be selected.

0 = Fully Open
1 = ThreeQuarterOpen
2 = Half Open
3 = Quarter Open
4 = Close

ControlAwning.title: Device description
ControlAwning.name: ControlAwning
ControlAwning.overview: With this device a awning can be controlled. Use the arrow keys to move the awning outwards or inwards at full speed. The actual value of the slider shows the current position of the awning. By operating the slider, the desired target position can be changed and the awning can be moved there according to the controller's logic. The current position is displayed in the output field. Via the event display an error can be indicated by the device. In addition, the movement time can be indicated separately in seconds. It is also possible to control the basic position movement.

ThermostatDigital.title: Device description
ThermostatDigital.name: VariableOutputField
ThermostatDigital.overview: With this device a digital thermostat can be implemented. The setpoint temperature can be adjusted via the Plus and Minus button. The Output field can be used to display the currently desired and adjusted setpoint value on the controller. Via the 2 switches it is possible to activate a reduction mode and switch from heating to cooling. The 4 Input fields for the times can be used to specify 1 separate heating or cooling times from which the thermostat should be active. This function must be activated via the 2 switch.  Via the event display an error can be indicated by the device. The red circle indicates whether heating is in progress. The blue circle indicates whether cooling is in progress. NOTE FOR SWITCH : If within 5 seconds the appropriate status does not return to the command that was sent, the switch automatically sends the "On" command once and than the "Off" command.

WeatherStation.overview: With this device a weather station can be visualized with its most common measuring points. The brightness value of the directions east, south and west can be measured. The dusk and dawn value can be measured. In addition, the humidity and the wind speed can be recorded. Furthermore it is indicated whether there is rainfall at the moment or not. Via the event display, an error can be indicated by the device.

HeatingMeter.title: Device description
HeatingMeter.name: HeatingMeter
HeatingMeter.overview: With this device a heating meter can be visualized. This runs the 9 most common values. The current heat output in kW and the 3 meter readings in kWh. These are the meter readings T1 and T2 for heating and the resulting total meter reading for heating. The meter reading in m³ of the water consumption and the current flow rate in m³/h is also displayed. In addition, the flow and return flow temperatures are displayed in °C and their spread in K.  Via the event display, an error can be indicated by the device.

MotionSensor.title: Device description
MotionSensor.name: MotionSensor
MotionSensor.overview: With this device a motion detector can be implemented. The Input field can be used to set the time period for which the motion detector should remain switched on after a person has been detected. Via the switch, the motion detector can be manually set to a permanent state. This can be permanent off or permanent on. The push button can be used to send an impulse to the motion detector to turn it on for the set time.  Via the event display, an error can be indicated by the device. NOTE FOR SWITCH : If within 5 seconds the appropriate status does not return to the command that was sent, the switch automatically sends the "On" command once and than the "Off" command.

With the push button the generator can be reset if necessary in case of an error.  Via the event display, an error can be indicated by the device. ElectricChargingStation.title: Device description
ElectricChargingStation.name: ElectricChargingStation
ElectricChargingStation.overview: With this device a charging station can be realized. In the Output fields, the effective power of the charging station can be displayed and the charging time that has elapsed. In the Input field, the minimum power in kW can be entered, which should always be available in the charging station. This can make sense, for example, if the charging station is operated via an EMS on the controller. With a switch the charging station can be set into a manual mode and with the slider you can select which power should be available. With the 2 switch the mode for the minimum power can be activated. The small green circle indicates whether the vehicle is successfully connected to the charging station. Via the event display, an error can be indicated by the device. NOTE FOR SWITCH : If within 5 seconds the appropriate status does not return to the command that was sent, the switch automatically sends the "On" command once and than the "Off" command.

MusicSystem.overview: This device can be used to realize the most common signals to control a music system. The volume level can be adjusted via plus and minus. MotorWithoutVFD.name: MotorWithoutVFD
MotorWithoutVFD.overview: This device can be used to control a motor which is not speed controlled. The upper 3 push buttons can be used to switch between the modes Auto, Manual and Inactive. The 4 push-buttons can be used to reset the motor in the event of a malfunction. The Output field can be used to display the current power consumption of the motor The arrows can be used to select the direction of rotation in manual mode. MixingValve.title: Device description
MixingValve.name: MixingValve
MixingValve.overview: With this device the control for a mixing valve can be realized. The upper 3 buttons can be used to switch between the modes auto, manual and inactive. With the 4 push buttons the mixing valve can be reset in case of an error. With the slider the position of the mixing valve can be selected in manual mode. Additionally the slider shows the actual position of the mixing valve. The output field shows the current position of the valve. The Event Viewer can be used to display an error from the unit.

Ventilation.title: Device description
Ventilation.name: Ventilation
Ventilation.overview: This device can be used to control a ventilation system. With the switch it is possible to change whether the ventilation should run in auto mode or in manual mode. In manual mode, the Input field can be used to set the power at which the ventilation should run. The 2 Output fields display the speeds for the supply air and exhaust air valve door. The 2 green dots represent the change of the supply or exhaust air filter.  The red event display can be used to indicate an error from the device. With the Reset button the error can be reset. NOTE FOR SWITCH : If within 5 seconds the appropriate status does not return to the command that was sent, the switch automatically sends the "On" command once and than the "Off" command.

DropDownOutputFieldWithVariable.title: Device description
DropDownOutputFieldWithVariable.name: DropDownOutputFieldWithVariable
DropDownOutputFieldWithVariable.overview: This Drop down output field can be used to output texts in connection with a number. When creating the device, numbers can be added and the corresponding texts can be assigned. If the device receives the respective number from the controller, the corresponding text is displayed. This device is especially suitable for the data type ENUM on the side of the control. With the Drop Down field only receiving and displaying can be done with this Device, nothing can be sent. An icon can be freely assigned to the device when it is created.

TSGFrischwasser.title: Device description
TSGFrischwasser.name: TSG Fresh Water
TSGFrischwasser.overview: This device can be used to control and visualise a fresh water system from TSG.

table.name: Offset Redox
table.description: This value can be used to specify the offset of the ORP probe to correct the output value.

table.name: Min Value Redox
table.description: This value can be used to specify the offset of the ORP probe to correct the output value.

table.name: Max Value Redox
table.description: This value can be used to specify the maximum value for the redox probe at which an alarm is generated and regulated to if no pulses come from the water meter for a certain time but the maximum value has not yet been reached.

table.name: Allways On
table.description: With this value, the pump can be switched to continuous mode. This means that if the Max value has not yet been reached or the water meter delivers pulses, the pump delivers a continuous signal instead of pulses, i.e. it is on as long as pulses are coming from the water meter or the Max value has not yet been reached.

table.name: Pulse Duration
table.description: This value can be used to specify the pulse length of the pump.

table.name: Break Time
table.description: With this value, the breake time between the pulses of the pump can be set.

table.name: Allways On Time
table.description: This value can be used to specify the allways-on time, when the pump is operated in continuous on mode. The pump than continues to run for the time after the last pulse was received.

table.name: Hour On
table.description: This value can be used to specify the hours from when the washing system is in switch-on mode.

table.name: Minute On
table.description: This value can be used to specify the minute from which the washing system is in switch-on mode.

table.name: Hour Off
table.description: This value can be used to specify the hours from when the washing system is in switch-off mode.

table.name: Minute Off
table.description: This value can be used to specify the minute from which the washing system is in switch-off mode.

table.name: Time to go Max Value
table.description: With this value it is possible to set when the pump should regulate to the max value of the probe after the last impulse of the water meter if this has not been reached. In seconds

table.name: Max Water Flow
table.description: This value can be used to set the maximum amount of fresh water that is allowed to flow when the washing system is in switch-off mode.

table.name: Max Chemistry Flow
table.description: This value can be used to set the maximum amount of chemical that is allowed to flow when the washing system is in switch-off mode.

table.name: Min Chemistry Flow
table.description: This value can be used to set how much minimum chemical must flow in 24 hours.

table.name: Reset
table.description: With this value, some alarms of the function can be reset. Not all alarms can be reset manually

table.name: Reset State
table.description: This value returns the current reset status.

table.name: Error Warning State
table.description: Here you can specify a variable that indicates a warning or an error directly on the unit. The warning is indicated by orange flashing, an error by red flashing.

table.name: State Float Switch
table.description: This value can be used to display the status of the float switch.

table.name: State Reed Contact
table.description: This value can be used to display the status of the reed contact in the chemical container.

table.name: State Allways On
table.description: This value provides the current congestion of the pump's continuous on mode.

table.name: Value Redox
table.description: This value provides the current value of the redox probe.

table.name: Actual Flow Water
table.description: This value provides the current flow rate of the water meter.
table.allowedValues: 0 – Max of 64 Bit Variable in l/min

table.name: Actual Flow Chemistry
table.description: This value provides the current flow rate of the chemical meter.

table.name: Counter Water
table.description: This value provides the current meter reading of the water meter.

table.name: Counter Chemistry
table.description: This value provides the current counter reading of the chemistry counter

table.name: Alarm Message
table.description: This value shows the current alarm message.
table.allowedValues:
0 = No alarm
1 = Too much fresh water consumption
2 = Too much chemical consumption
3 = Excessive consumption of chemicals and fresh water
4 = Chemical consumption too low
5 = Min-Wert der Redox-Sonde erreicht
6 = Max value of the redox probe reached
7 = Float switch has tripped
8 = Reed Contact chemical container has triggered

table.name: Error Message
table.description: This value shows the current error message.
table.allowedValues:
0 = No errors
1 = KL1512 Configuration error
2 = Redox sensor AI error
3 = System time error
4 = Error on-off switching time

EnergyView.title: Device description
EnergyView.name: EnergyViewPreview
EnergyView.overview: This device represents an energy overview of all common large producers and consumers in a building. In the main view you can find each device maximum 1 time. If there are more than one of the same device, it will be displayed in the main view. The power value is than the sum of all power values of the individual devices. For the SOC of the battery, the average is displayed if there are several battery systems. To see each device individually, you can click on the respective device in the main view. This opens a 2 window with all devices of the respective type. The power lines in the graph are animated to show the direction in which the energies are flowing. Depending on the selection and number of devices, the Energy View display is compiled differently.
